robeger writes:
> FYI, you have "au" as one of your extensions, which causes problems if
> you are crawling any sites in Australia (.au domain).  Caused me some
> frustrations until I figured out what was going on.  Haven't looked
> through the list to see if there are any other top level domains in there.

I'm surprised this is being applied against the domains --- the filter
should only be applied against the end of a full-qualified URL, so
even a TLD should have a '/' at the end which would preclude this
regex from matching.

    -tree
